body: Hi there @mnuthan1 - Please upgrade to the latest version of Vagrant and try again. Thanks!
Hi, I have upgraded it to 2.2.2 and seeing same issue. The behaviour is unpredictable.
@mnuthan1 - do you have a debug log for when a file provisioner fails to copy files to the guest?

@mnuthan1 - the debug link you shared doesn't show any file provisioners at all, just that your scripts are failing from a partial debug log. If you have a gist that shows the full output of running `vargant up --debug`, with the file provisioners all running, that would give us more information on if they are actually running and adding the files to the guest or not. Thanks!

I have updated the gist with debug log.  
[Debug Log](https://gist.github.com/mnuthan1/1433b5a72ba3279639b86d83bcaa758c)

I also changed my vagrantfile to print output of ls command after file copy 

`config.vm.provision "file", source: "./scripts/pq3ss.jks", destination: "/vagrant/pq3ss.jks"

    config.vm.provision "shell",
        inline: "ls -al /vagrant; if [ ! -f /vagrant/pq3ss.jks ]; then echo 'keystore not found!'; exit 1; fi"

    config.vm.provision "file", source: "./scripts/cleanup.sh", destination: "/vagrant/cleanup.sh"

    config.vm.provision "shell",
        inline: "ls -al /vagrant; if [ ! -f /vagrant/cleanup.sh ]; then echo 'cleanup script not found!'; exit 1;fi

Hello @mnuthan1 - I do see a file being provisioned, but it's hard to determine what is going on with a partial debug log.   __Again, please give us the _full_ debug log  from the beginning of running `vagrnat up --debug`.__

For example I see that the file `.p4trust` is being provisioned, but you didn't mention that in your comment above here :thinking: Also at the beginning of that debug log there's a script that exits 1.

```
DEBUG ssh: Uploading: /Users/svc_productivity_q3/workspace/Refresh nmallavaram-wsm nodes/scripts/.p4trust to /vagrant/.p4trust
```
There's another file provision step after this, but it doesn't look like it ever completes. I think it would be better if you could try to reproduce this with a more simplified Vagrantfile.

```ruby
Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
  config.vm.provision "file", source: "./scripts/linux/hello.sh", destination: "script.sh"
  config.vm.provision "file", source: "./scripts/linux/hello.sh", destination: "other.sh"
  config.vm.provision "file", source: "./scripts/linux/hello.sh", destination: "test.sh"
  config.vm.define "bork" do |b|
    b.vm.box = "bento/ubuntu-18.04"

    b.vm.provision "shell", inline:<<-SHELL
    ls -lah
    SHELL

    b.vm.provision "shell", path: "scripts/linux/hello.sh"

    b.vm.provider :virtualbox
  end
end
```

And the script....

```shell
echo "hello there"
```

```brian@localghost:vagrant-sandbox % be vagrant up bork                                                    ±[●][master]
Bringing machine 'bork' up with 'virtualbox' provider...
==> bork: Importing base box 'bento/ubuntu-18.04'...

==> bork: Booting VM...
==> bork: Waiting for machine to boot. This may take a few minutes...

    bork: SSH username: vagrant

    bork: Vagrant insecure key detected. Vagrant will automatically replace

==> bork: Machine booted and ready!
```

If you copy my Vagrantfile above, do those file provisioners show up for you?

@briancain  here is my new Vagrant file

```ruby 
Vagrant.require_version ">= 1.6.2"
VAGRANTFILE_API_VERSION = "2"
hostname = "#{`hostname | cut -d. -f1 | awk '{printf $0}'`}"
puts %Q{ This machine has the IP  and host name '#{hostname}'. }
BOX_NAME="MAC_BOX"
BOX_URL = "<BOX_URL>"
SYNC_LC="test"
# This defines the version of vagrant
Vagrant.configure(VAGRANTFILE_API_VERSION) do |config|
	# Specifying the box we wish to use
    config.vm.synced_folder ".", "/vagrant", disabled: true
	config.vm.box = BOX_NAME
	config.vm.box_url = BOX_URL
	# Adding Bridged Network Adapter
    #config.vm.network "public_network", bridge: "en0: Ethernet 1"
    config.ssh.username = "iosadmin"
    config.vm.provision "shell", path: "scripts/config-wrapper.sh", privileged:false, name:"update-hostname", args: ["#{ENV['PASSWORD']}",hostname]
    config.vm.provision "shell", path: "scripts/bootstrap.sh", privileged:false, name:"folder-create", args: "#{ENV['PASSWORD']}"
    
    ### rsync in mac HighSierra file system not working (NFS file system issue)
    ### source all required scripts
    #config.vm.synced_folder "./scripts", "/vagrant", id: "scripts",create: true, type: "rsync"
    config.vm.provision "file", source: "./scripts/.p4trust", destination: "/vagrant/.p4trust"
    config.vm.provision "file", source: "./scripts/pq3ss.jks", destination: "/vagrant/pq3ss.jks"
    config.vm.provision "shell",
        inline: "ls -al /vagrant; if [ ! -f /vagrant/pq3ss.jks ]; then echo 'keystore not found!'; exit 1; fi"
    config.vm.provision "file", source: "./scripts/cleanup.sh", destination: "/vagrant/cleanup.sh"
    config.vm.provision "shell",
        inline: "ls -al /vagrant; if [ ! -f /vagrant/cleanup.sh ]; then echo 'cleanup script not found!'; exit 1; fi"
    config.vm.provision "file", source: "./scripts/support/set_kcpassword.py", destination: "/vagrant/support/set_kcpassword.py"
    
    # Avoid running uiabuild.sh if the server is dedicated for Ansible jobs
    if "#{ENV['WITH_BLT']}".to_s.empty? || "#{ENV['WITH_BLT']}" == "true"
        puts "Creating Nodes with blt..";
        config.vm.provision "shell", path: "scripts/uiabuild.sh",privileged:false, name:"blt-env", args: [
            "#{ENV['PASSWORD']}",
            SYNC_CL,
            "#{ENV['SYNC_AND_COMPILE']}",
            "#{ENV['P4USER']}",
            "#{ENV['P4PASSWD']}"
        ]
    else
        puts "Creating Nodes for Ansible setup (with out blt) ";
        SYNC_CL = "";
    end

    config.trigger.before :destroy do |trigger|
      trigger.info = "removing P4 client destroying the VM..."
      trigger.run_remote = {inline: "echo #{ENV['PASSWORD']} | sudo -S sh -c  /vagrant/cleanup.sh"}
      trigger.on_error = :continue
    end

    config.vm.define "node1" do |node1|
        node1.vm.provider "virtualbox" do |vb|
            vb.name = "#{hostname}_q3_vm1_#{SYNC_CL}"
            vb.memory = 16384
            vb.cpus = 2
        end
        # Forwarding SSH and VNC ports on VM. N.B., SSH (22) is already
        # forwarded to 2222. Keeping configuration line in for documentation.
        node1.vm.network "forwarded_port", guest: 22, host: 2222, auto_correct: true
    end
    config.vm.define "node2" do |node2|
        node2.vm.provider "virtualbox" do |vb|
            vb.name = "#{hostname}_q3_vm2_#{SYNC_CL}"
            vb.memory = 16384
            vb.cpus = 2
        end
        # Forwarding SSH and VNC ports on VM. N.B., SSH (22) is already
        # forwarded to 2223. Keeping configuration line in for documentation.
        node2.vm.network "forwarded_port", guest: 22, host: 2223, auto_correct: true
    end
end
```

and the full debug log (line number 11394 has the copy command)
[Error Debug log](https://gist.github.com/mnuthan1/093f867ee64a755d3bdff54d5694fc36)

**My Observations:**
It never failed during copy of .p4trust file and the log shows
_DEBUG ssh: Uploading: /Users/svc_productivity_q3/workspace/Refresh nmallavaram-wsm nodes/scripts/.p4trust to **/vagrant/.p4trust** (destination folder is actual path)_

where as  for jks file logs shows different destination folder
_DEBUG ssh: Uploading: /Users/svc_productivity_q3/workspace/Refresh nmallavaram-wsm nodes/scripts/pq3ss.jks to **41e57d38-b4f7-4e46-9c38-13873d338b86-vagrant-ssh/vagrant/pq3ss.jks**_ 

and this is the log entry on success case . (and this time folder path is correct)

_DEBUG ssh: Uploading: /Users/svc_productivity_q3/workspace/Refresh nmallavaram-wsm nodes/scripts/pq3ss.jks to /vagrant/pq3ss.jks_

Please note that this behaviour is un predictable. I could able to see this error on 4th run. (it copied all the files for the first 3 runs) and some times the error comes while bringing node1 up and some times during node2 up

@mnuthan1 Aha! Ok, thanks. I see the issue now, but not entirely sure yet as to what the cause is. It looks like in that last debug gist the "missing" files all for some reason got path expanded to have `41e57d38-b4f7-4e46-9c38-13873d338b86-vagrant-ssh/...` before the destination path.

Anyway that gives us something to go on. Thanks for all the info and logs!

rename.to: MacOS incorrectly path expands guest folder occasionally with File provisioner
